articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Iran IRGC says senior commander Soleimani killed - state tv
articles.description: Iran's elite Revolutionary Guards confirmed on Friday Major-General Qassem Soleimani, head of the elite Quds Force, was killed, state-television reported. (Reporting by Dubai newsroom Editing by Shri Navaratnam)'
articles.content: Jan 3 (Reuters) - Iran’s elite Revolutionary Guards confirmed on Friday Major-General Qassem Soleimani, head of the elite Quds Force, was killed, state-television reported. (Reporting by Dubai newsroom Editing by Shri Navaratnam)

articles.author: Jonathan Barrett
articles.title: Residents flee as fires sweep toward Australia's alpine region
articles.description: The Australian village of Thredbo in the Snowy Mountains region has been evacuated and is under threat from fast-approaching fires that have razed bushland in the country's east.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - The Australian village of Thredbo in the Snowy Mountains region has been evacuated and is under threat from fast-approaching fires that have razed bushland in the country’s east. 
The mountain area is located 200 km (125 miles) inland from… [+2299 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Australia PM inclined to cancel India trip due to bushfire crisis
articles.description: Australia Prime Minister Scott Morrison on Friday said he was inclined to cancel an official trip to India planned for this month in order to deal with a bushfire crisis ravaging parts of his country.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Australia Prime Minister Scott Morrison on Friday said he was inclined to cancel an official trip to India planned for this month in order to deal with a bushfire crisis ravaging parts of his country.

articles.description: (Reuters Breakingviews) - Betting group Genting is not the bookies' favourite as it competes for a coveted casino licence in Japan. The Malaysian outfit lacks the scale or the glitz of rivals in Las Vegas and Macau but it has an ace up its sleeve to enter the…

articles.author: Wayne Cole
articles.title: Dollar stumbles to nine-week low against safe-haven yen as Mideast tensions flare
articles.description: The Japanese yen led other safe-haven assets higher on Friday after air strikes on Baghdad airport killed a senior Iranian military official, stoking tensions in the Middle East and lifting the price of oil.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - The Japanese yen led other safe-haven assets higher on Friday after air strikes on Baghdad airport killed a senior Iranian military official, stoking tensions in the Middle East and lifting the price of oil. 
U.S. Treasury bonds and gold r… [+2677 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S. strike killed Iran Quds Force chief Soleimani - U.S. official
articles.description: The United States carried out a strike that killed Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani, head of the elite Quds Force, a U.S. official who spoke on condition of anonymity said on Thursday.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The United States carried out a strike that killed Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani, head of the elite Quds Force, a U.S. official who spoke on condition of anonymity said on Thursday. 
Reporting by Arshad Mohammed; Editing by Er… [+7 chars]

articles.author: Andrew Galbraith
articles.title: Stocks extend New Year cheer, Mideast air strikes drive oil higher
articles.description: Asian shares extended their New Year's rally on Friday after Wall Street struck another record high on fresh Chinese stimulus while oil spiked after U.S. air strikes in Iraq heightened geopolitical tensions.
articles.content:
SHANGHAI (Reuters) - Asian shares extended their New Year’s rally on Friday after Wall Street struck another record high on fresh Chinese stimulus while oil spiked after U.S. air strikes in Iraq heightened geopolitical tensions.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: METALS-Shanghai aluminium slips to 2-week low as China stocks climb
articles.description:
Shanghai aluminium prices fell in
early trade on Friday, having hit a more than two-week low under
14,000 yuan ($2,009.96) a tonne overnight on signs that stocks
in top consumer China were rising again after a protracted drop
over 2019.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Indonesia plans cloud seeding to halt rain as floods death toll hits 30
articles.description: Indonesia will carry out cloud seeding on Friday in a bid to prevent further rainfall over the capital Jakarta, after deadly flash floods and landslides following some of the heaviest rains in more than 20 years.
articles.content:
JAKARTA (Reuters) - Indonesia will carry out cloud seeding on Friday in a bid to prevent further rainfall over the capital Jakarta, after deadly flash floods and landslides following some of the heaviest rains in more than 20 years.
